title: Tuple field names in debuginfo are prefixed with `__`.

labels.name: A-debuginfo
labels.description: Area: Debugging information in compiled programs (DWARF, PDB, etc.)

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
The DWARF debugging information entries for tuple field names (and for the field names of tuple-like structs and variants) are prefixed with `__`.  For instance, `Option`'s `Some` variant is recorded as having a field named `__0`, rather than `0`.

I think this is a little unfortunate. Tuple indices behave quite like field names in Rust, insofar that they're accessed with `.` and that you can instantiate tuple-like structs and variants as if they are records; e.g.:
```rust
Some { 0: true };
```
It's odd, then, that these fields would not appear in a debugger as they would in Rust.

My own stake in this is [deflect](https://docs.rs/deflect/0.1.0/deflect/), allows you to get fields by name from structs and variants. Users reflecting on tuple-like structs and variants must know to prefix their queries with `__`, and the pretty-printer and serializers provided by `deflect` cannot generally strip away the `__` from field names.
